synopsis.text:
Japanese folklore and historical context intertwine in Fuse Gansaku: Satomi Hakkenden, an anime that explores the lives of eight samurai serving the Satomi clan during the Sengoku era. The samurai, believed to be reincarnations of spirits born from a princess and a dog, find themselves entangled in a cycle of vengeance and retribution.

In the heart of Edo, rumors of human-dog hybrids, known as Fuse, preying on humans and consuming their souls have led the Shogun Government to place a hefty bounty on their heads. Enter Hamaji, a skilled huntress hailing from rural Mutsu, who journeys to Edo to assist her brother in hunting these creatures. However, her mission takes an unexpected turn when she crosses paths with Shino, a mysterious young Fuse on the run.

As Hamaji grapples with her newfound friendship with Shino, she finds herself caught between her life as a determined huntress and the unfamiliar world unveiled by her Fuse companion. Torn between two worlds, Hamaji embarks on a journey of self-discovery and moral dilemmas, all while navigating the bustling city of Edo and its supernatural underbelly.
